awd_abstract_narration: This three-year grant supports the work of Professor                       Robert Panvini, a post-doctoral associate and several graduate                  students on the completion of the construction of the "SLD"                     experiment at the Stanford Linear Collider.  SLD will study                     electron-positron annihilations at an energy of 100 Gev.  The                   group will concentrate on the central drift chamber, event                      simulation and data analysis.                                                        The work supported here is on one of a new generation of                   experiments which will study the structure of matter at a new                   and shorter distance scale.  The particles produced in these                    collisions will tell us about the validity of current theories                  of matter and forces, and in particular give us information on                  the number of "generations" of elementary particles.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
